Sequence Information.Peptide Name: OTAP-92 (fragment of ovotransferrin, synthetic AMPs20, 3S=S; UCSS1a; BBMm)
Sequence Information.Source: acid cleaved natural fragment, Sequence truncation, animal-derived, natural derivative
Sequence Information.Crucial residues: The peptide lost antibacterial activity when its disulfide bonds were reduced.

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that this peptide is most similar (29%) toAmylocyclicin. Ovotransferrin antimicrobial peptide (OTAP-92) is a fragment of hen ovotransferrin (OTf) (residues 109-200).  Generated via specific clavage at Asp under diluted acid.Chemical modification:  Three S-S bonds: Cys115–Cys197, Cys160–Cys174, and Cys171–Cys182.MOA:bacteria:E. coli: Permeated E. coli membranes.Activity:  Active against S. aureus and E. coli. The original Bombinin GH_D (inactive) has been replaced.updated 10/2020; formatted 11/2024.
Literature Information.Author: Ibrahim HR, Iwamori E, Sugimoto Y, Aoki T. 1998
Literature Information.Title: Identification of a distinct antibacterial domain within the N-lobe of ovotransferrin
